title: 114_hr2513
content:
The Act titled "Promoting Access, Competition, and Equity Act of 2015" or "PACE Act of 2015" confirms the methodology for the Hospital Star Rating System through Hospital Compare. The Secretary is required to use the same methodology as of April 16, 2015, for computing star ratings for hospitals before October 1, 2019, to ensure consistent longitudinal comparisons. Regulations may be changed for star ratings after October 1, 2019. SEC. 3. REVISED CRITERIA FOR APPLICATION AND EXCEPTIONS TO MORATORIUM ON EXPANSION AND CONSTRUCTION OF PHYSICIAN-OWNED HOSPITALS. Temporary Suspension of Limitation on Hospitals applying for facility expansions until September 30, 2019, with exceptions for high Medicaid facilities. The limitation does not apply to applications filed before October 1, 2019. The Social Security Act is amended to include hospitals with consistently high quality ratings as eligible facilities for certain provisions. The term 'hospital with a consistently high quality rating' refers to a hospital that has received a rating of 3 stars or higher for 12 consecutive calendar quarters. Additionally, special rules apply to hospitals under development as of March 23, 2010. Special timing rule for hospitals under development as of March 23, 2010: Any reference to the date of enactment or December 31, 2010, is deemed to be May 1, 2015. The term "hospital under development as of March 23, 2010" refers to a hospital with a binding agreement for construction, renovation, lease, or demolition before March 23, 2010. The term "hospital under development as of March 23, 2010" includes hospitals that have expended at least 10 percent of the project cost before that date or obtained a certificate of need in a State where required. It also covers facility expansions completed before the under development effective date, defined as 6 months after the enactment of this paragraph. Changes in processing applications and elimination of appeals limitation are also addressed in the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to streamline the application process for hospital expansions, with applications deemed complete 30 days after submission. The Secretary must publish a notice within 60 days of receiving a complete application. The Social Security Act is amended to streamline the application process for hospital expansions. Applications will be deemed approved by the Secretary within 60 days of receipt unless a notice of disapproval is provided before that time. Amendments take effect upon enactment and apply to future applications. SEC. 4. SAVINGS FROM PHYSICIAN-OWNED HOSPITALS. (a) Documentation and Coding Adjustments Not Applicable.--Section 7(b)(1)(B)(iii) of the TMA, Abstinence Education, and QI Programs Extension Act of 2007, as amended by the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act of 2015, is amended regarding hospitals with physician ownership interests. 
(b) Extension of Reductions in Market Basket Increases.--Section 1886(b)(3)(B)(xii) of the Social Security Act is amended by removing "and" at the end of subclause (IV). The text chunk describes amendments to the TMA regarding hospitals with physician ownership interests. It includes adjustments to market basket increases for fiscal years 2020 through 2025 based on physician ownership or investment interest in the hospital.
